contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Ken Foggo | image = | fullname = Kenneth Taylor Foggo | birth_date = {{Birth date|1943|11|7|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Perth, Scotland|Perth]], Scotland | death_date = | height = | position = [[Winger (sport)|Winger]] | youthyears1 = 1959–1960 | youthclubs1 = [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] (amateur) | years1 = 1960–1967 | years2 = 1967–1973 | years3 = 1973–1975 | years4 = 1973 | years5 = 1975–1976 | years6 = 1976–1980 | clubs1 = [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] | clubs2 = [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] | clubs3 = [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] | clubs4 = → [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] (loan) | clubs5 = [[Southend United F.C.|Southend United]] | clubs6 = [[Chelmsford City F.C.|Chelmsford City]] | caps1 = 129 | caps2 = 185 | caps3 = 60 | caps4 = ? | caps5 = 30 | caps6 = ? <!--League games only--> | goals1 = 29 | goals2 = 54 | goals3 = 3 | goals4 = ? | goals5 = 6 | goals6 = ? }} '''Kenneth Taylor Foggo''' (born 7 November 1943, [[Perth, Scotland]]) is a former [[football (soccer)|football]] player. He started his football career with [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]], but is best remembered for his time with [[Norwich City F.C.]], for which he played from 1967 to 1972. While playing for Norwich as a [[Winger (sport)|winger]], he won the [[Norwich City player of the year|Player of the Year]] award twice and was the team's top scorer in three successive years. He was a member of the Norwich team that won the second division championship in 1972 and promotion to the top division for the first time in the club's history. After leaving Norwich in 1972 he played for [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] and [[Southend United F.C.|Southend United]]. ==Honours== * [[Football League Second Division|Second Division]] Championship [[1971-72 in English football|1971-72]] * [[Norwich City player of the year]] 1969, 1971 ==References== *''Canary Citizens'' by Mike Davage, John Eastwood, Kevin Platt, published by Jarrold Publishing, (2001), ISBN 0-7117-2020-7 {{Norwich City F.C. Player of the Year}} {{Persondata |NAME = Foggo, Kenneth Taylor |ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Foggo, Ken |SHORT DESCRIPTION = Scottish footballer |DATE OF BIRTH = 7 November 1943 |PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Perth, Scotland]] |DATE OF DEATH = |PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Foggo, Ken}} [[Category:1943 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Scottish footballers]] [[Category:West Bromwich Albion F.C. players]] [[Category:Norwich City F.C. players]] [[Category:Portsmouth F.C. players]] [[Category:Brentford F.C. players]] [[Category:Southend United F.C. players]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Perth, Scotland]] [[Category:Association football wingers]] {{Scotland-footy-midfielder-stub}}
